content: The reference is to the ImportExportTools NG add-on, but it can be done by simply adding the eml files to a subfolder of Local Folders by drag and drop from Windows File Explorer.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Click on 'Address Book' Select the address book you want to save Right-click the address book name; choose Export Choose where you want to save the exported file. (Do not choose a folder in a Thunderbird folder.) Save as type: Comma Separated csv. Give the file a name.

Then when you have the new installation finished, Select the address book you want to restore the contacts to. Right-click and choose 'Import' Navigate to the file you saved earlier. Select it. (Use the Continue button as you go through these steps.)
creator: danawilson001

content: Do leave it alone. If you ever have local folders, then any content that is deleted will go to the local folders trash folder.
creator: davidsk

content: click help>moretroubleshootinginformation. Then scroll down to the Mail & News Account matrix to see if gmail is still listed. If so, click to account settings, highlight the account, scroll to 'account Actions' and click 'delete.'
creator: davidsk

content: Generally, if a password is incorrect, TB will post for a password. You can manually do this by these steps: - click settings>privacy&security - click 'saved passwords' and then 'show passwords' - highlight the row that has password to be changed and rightclick to see the 'edit password' option.
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest deleting the account, shutting down TB, restart and do setup again.
creator: davidsk
